    • Uses of PublisherConfig in com.dotcms.publisher.receiver

      Methods in com.dotcms.publisher.receiver that return PublisherConfig 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PublisherConfig BundlePublisher.init(PublisherConfig config)
      Initializes this Publisher adding all the handlers that can interact with a Bundle.
      PublisherConfig BundlePublisher.process(PublishStatus status)
      Processes a Bundle, in order to do that it: Un-compress the Bundle file, then each handler for this Publisher will check if inside
      the bundle there is content it needs to be handle as each Handler handles a different type of content, and finally
      after the "handle" for each Handler the status are set depending if was a successful operation or not.
      Methods in com.dotcms.publisher.receiver with parameters of type PublisherConfig 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PublisherConfig BundlePublisher.init(PublisherConfig config)
      Initializes this Publisher adding all the handlers that can interact with a Bundle.

      PublishStatus PublisherAPIImpl.publish(PublisherConfig config) 
      PublishStatus PublisherAPI.publish(PublisherConfig config)
      This method call will create and send to an specified Environments a Bundle, in order to do that it will follow this main steps:
      Calls all the registered IBundlers associated to a specified Publisher (IPublisher.getBundlers())
      in order generate for each of them the different parts and objects of the bundle we are trying to create. The Publisher will call it process method (Publisher.process(PublishStatus)) in order to compress
      all the generated content by the Bundlers and create the final Bundle file that will be send to a specific Environment.
      PublishStatus PublisherAPIImpl.publish(PublisherConfig config, PublishStatus status) 
      PublishStatus PublisherAPI.publish(PublisherConfig config, PublishStatus status)
      This method call will create and send to an specified Environments a Bundle, in order to do that it will follow this main steps:
      Calls all the registered IBundlers associated to a specified Publisher (IPublisher.getBundlers())
      in order generate for each of them the different parts and objects of the bundle we are trying to create. The Publisher will call it process method (Publisher.process(PublishStatus)) in order to compress
      all the generated content by the Bundlers and create the final Bundle file that will be send to a specific Environment.
      static PublisherConfig BundlerUtil.readBundleXml(PublisherConfig config)
      Reads the main bundle.xml file inside a bundle directory in order to create based on that file a PublisherConfig object
      void IBundler.setConfig(PublisherConfig pc)

      write bundle down
